p: Primary cutaneous diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (PCDLBCL), leg type is a rare malignancy, which make up approximately 4% of all cutaneous lymphomas and 20% of all primary cutaneous B cell lymphomas (CBCLs) ( 5). PCDLBCL commonly occurs on one or both legs, with 10 to 15% of cases involving other sites. The 5-year survival of PCDLBCL is approximately 50%, which is far worse than other CBCLs ( 6, 7).
